choices.C: Use the otv flood mac <> command to selectively flood traffic for a given MAC.
choices.A: Use route map to statically advertise this MAC and redistribute with IS-IS.
choices.D: Use the otv isis bfd <> command to configure BFD protocol.
choices.B: Unknown unicast flooding is not allowed.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

Selected Answer: C
C must be correct.
According to Here_comes_MrLamb's cisco pdf, page 6.

Correct is C

https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/products/collateral/switches/nexus-7000-series-switches/guide_c07-728315.pdf

With the Cisco NX-OS Release 6.2(2), we now support selective unknown unicast flooding based on the MAC address. In order to use this feature, the following one-line configuration must be added:
OTV-VDC(config)# otv flood mac 0000.2101.1111 vlan 72

Shouldn't this be C?

otv flood mac
To enable selective unicast Overlay Transport Virtualization (OTV) flooding, use the otv flood mac command. To revert to the default setting, use the no form of this command.
otv flood mac mac-address vlan vlan-id

questions.question_text:
A mission-critical server is connected to site A. Connectivity to this server is lost from site B because the MAC route is missing in the OTV VDC of the Cisco Nexus
7000 in site B due to MAC aging. Which action allows the flooding of the unknown unicast MAC on the Nexus 7000 in the OTV VDC?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Shoul be B

Refer to the exhibit. The VXLAN communication fails between Server A and Server C. Server A and Server B can communicate, but Server C can only reach Server B and its default gateway. Which action must be taken on Leaf-3 to resolve the issue?

choices.B: Assign the secondary template first, and then set the peer name.
choices.D: Assign the primary template first, and then set the peer name.
choices.A: Create the peer names before creating the templates.

questions.question_text: An attempt to use a global vNIC redundancy template pair results in a service profile that fails to apply. Which action resolves the issues?

discussion.content:

comments.content: The meaning may be the user not changing the default value 10.0.0.0/16 and mismatch the usage. So I think C correct.
what answer do you propose instead ?

choices.A: The leaf nodes were not erased properly, which caused a fabric parameters mismatch with the APIC1.
choices.B: Rebooting the APICs and the leaf and spine switches after wiping them is not required.
choices.C: The engineer did not enter the TEP Pool value during the Initial Setup dialog on APIC1.
choices.D: The same Fabric Name value should be used before and after wiping all devices.

questions.question_text: A Cisco ACI environment consists of three Cisco APICs, two spine switches, and four leaf switches. The engineer erases and reboots all APICs first, then leaf and spine switches individually, and then completes the Initial Setup dialog on the APIC1 CIMC KVM console. When the engineer logs in to the APIC1 web GUI, the engineer notices that there are no directly connected leaf switches being discovered under Fabric > Inventory > Fabric Membership. What is the cause of the issue?
